intro: Nepeta subincisa, commonly known as catnip, is a flowering plant in the mint family, Lamiaceae. It is native to Europe, western Asia, and North Africa, and is characterized by its aromatic leaves and spikes of small, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–90 cm, with slender, hairy stems and opposite, heart-shaped leaves. Its flowers are usually pale blue to purple and bloom in late spring to early summer. Nepeta subincisa is known for its strong scent, which is particularly attractive to cats and can also have mild effects on humans.
